events.title: Cremation pyre in Africa thought to be worldâ€™s oldest containing adult remains
events.description: 9,500-year-old pyre uncovered in Malawi offers rare insight into rituals of ancient African hunter-gatherer groups A cremation pyre built about 9,500 years ago has been discovered in Africa, offering a fresh glimpse into the complexity of ancient hunter-gatherer communities. Researchers say the pyre, discovered in a rock shelter at the foot of Mount Hora in northern Malawi, is thought to be the oldest in the world to contain adult remains, the oldest confirmed intentional cremation in Africa, and the first pyre to be associated with African hunter-gatherers. events.description: Merz is due in Bengaluru, often called India's Silicon Valley, after meeting PM Modi in Ahmedabad. The visit comes just weeks ahead of plans to sign a long-awaited free trade agreement between India and the EU.

events.title: Cannabis: Now you can measure how much is too much
events.description: At what point does smoking weed get dangerous? A British study measured cannabis consumption in THC units and determined which amounts increase health risks. The system comes with clear risk thresholds â€• and weaknesses.

events.title: Myanmar faces Rohingya genocide case: What to know
events.description: A landmark case accusing Myanmar of committing genocide against minority Muslim Rohingya has opened at the United Nations' top court. The outcome will have repercussions beyond the Southeast Asian nation.

events.title: Croatia reintroduces conscription after almost two decades
events.description: Croatia is bringing back compulsory military service for young men for the first time since 2008. Whatâ€™s behind the shift â€” and could it signal a wider return of conscription in the Balkans?

events.title: Why Venus Williams and other sports stars are playing longer
events.description: More than three decades after she burst onto the tennis scene, Venus Williams is still playing at the top level. Why are we seeing elite athletes carrying on into their 40s and beyond?

events.title: Malaysia, Indonesia block Grok AI bot over explicit images
events.description: The move comes after the bot was found to be generating explicit images of women and children, without consent, on Elon Musk's X.

events.title: Meta shuts over 544,000 Australian accounts after ban
events.description: The tech giant removed Facebook, Instagram and Threads accounts to comply with Australia's social media ban for under-16-year-olds.

events.title: Menopause: When hormones harm the economy
events.description: There are 9 million women of menopausal age in Germany's labor force. The change of life can have consequences for an economy. There are things that companies can do to retain their workers.

events.title: Trump to meet with Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado
events.description: Washington said on Monday that Venezuelan opposition figure Maria Corina Machado will meet President Donald Trump this week, a move that comes as pressure mounts on the interim leadership in Caracas to accelerate the release of political prisoners.

events.title: Ikone stuns Paris Saint-Germain as Paris FC reach French Cup last 16
events.description: Former Paris Saint-Germain academy product Jonathan Ikone struck a late winner against his old club as Paris FC shocked the holders 1-0 on Monday to book their place in the last 16 of the French Cup.

events.title: Iranians being kept in the dark about crackdown, observer says
events.description: Speaking with FRANCE 24's Mark Owen, Kevan GafaÃ¯ti, lecturer at Sciences Po Paris, who has just left Iran, says that many Iranians are being kept in the dark about the demonstrations and the brutal crackdown by the authorities due to the Internet blackout, which is preventing the population from organising.

events.title: Trump wants a deal but insists US will acquire Greenland 'one way or the other'
events.description: Donald Trump has said he wants to make a deal with Greenland and won't let Russia or China take control of the Arctic territory.

events.title: Myanmar accused of genocide against Rohingya minority in landmark UN case
events.description: Myanmar stands accused of committing genocide against members of the Rohingya ethnic minority in a case opening at a United Nations court this week.

events.title: Cyprus president's top aide quits after online video alleging government corruption
events.description: A top aide to Cyprus President Nikos Christodoulides has resigned after an online video was posted recently in which it was suggested that he and others were using their close ties to the leader to earn favors for would-be investors in exchange for cash

events.title: Londonâ€™s homicide rate is at a record low as mayor says it disproves Trump's 'dystopian' claims
events.description: London's murder rate fell in 2025 to its lowest level in decades, officials said Monday

events.title: UK agrees to pay 'substantial sum' to settle lawsuit by Guantanamo detainee over torture claims
events.description: The British government has agreed to pay a substantial sum to settle a lawsuit by Abu Zubaydah, a Guantanamo Bay detainee

events.title: Pope Leo XIV meets with Venezuelan opposition leader MarÃ­a Corina Machado
events.description: Pope Leo XIV has met with Venezuelan opposition leader MarÃ­a Corina Machado at the Vatican

events.title: Former Polish justice minister who faces prosecution at home says he's received asylum in Hungary
events.description: A former Polish justice minister who faces prosecution in his homeland over alleged abuse of power says he has been granted asylum in Hungary

events.title: New US ambassador to India pushes for deeper trade ties despite  oil tensions
events.description: The U.S. and India are actively working on a bilateral trade agreement to strengthen their economic and strategic partnership

events.title: UN court to begin hearings on whether Myanmar committed genocide against the Rohingya
events.description: Myanmar heard accusations that it is responsible for genocide against the Rohingya ethnic minority at the top court of the United Nations, as long-awaited hearings began on Monday

events.title: Off the ballot, Ugandan president's son waits in the wings this election
events.description: Muhoozi Kainerugaba, the Ugandan presidentâ€™s military son, is not on the ballot in Thursday's presidential election

events.title: Britain is in talks with NATO to counter Russia and China in the Arctic
events.description: Britain is discussing with NATO allies how to enhance Arctic security against Russia and China

events.title: Amidst uncertainty, a helpline in Pakistan becomes a lifeline for Afghans
events.description: They ask heartbreaking questions: â€œWhat will happen to us?â€ â€œIs it true they will deport us?â€ â€œWe donâ€™t want to go back. How can I live in Afghanistan?â€ The words of Sumaiya, who staffs a helpline for refugees and asylum-seekers living in Pakistan but facing the eventuality of having to return to neighbouring Afghanistan.

events.title: Minnesota sues Trump admin over sweeping immigration raids in Twin Cities
events.description: Minnesota sues Trump administration over alleged militarized immigration raids in Twin Cities, naming DHS Secretary Kristi Noem and ICE officials.

events.title: New Jersey man fractures girl's skull by allegedly throwing rock through school bus window, arrest made
events.description: A New Jersey man was arrested after allegedly throwing a rock that smashed through a school bus window, fracturing a young girlâ€™s skull, police said.

events.title: Barry Morphew pleads not guilty to murdering wife Suzanne Morphew years after after Motherâ€™s Day disappearance
events.description: Barry Morphew accused of killing wife Suzanne returns to court to enter plea on murder charges. Case began with her Mother's Day 2020 disappearance.

events.title: Trump says Iran 'starting to' cross US red lines and more top headlines
events.description: Get all the stories you need-to-know from the most powerful name in news delivered first thing every morning to your inbox.

events.title: Greenland leaders push back on Trump's calls for US control of the island: 'We donâ€™t want to be Americans'
events.description: Greenland leaders firmly reject President Donald Trump's proposed U.S. takeover as the American administration vows action regardless of their wishes.
